column2: Document Title: ITP-113-CIV-CPD-Inspection & Test Plan - Conduit & Pits - Rail (Supply and Install)
ITP Description: Conduit & Pits - Jemena HV relocation
ITP created by: Lachlan Morris/Pat Sabaruddin
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Talasila
1.3 - Plastic Industry Pipe Association - Industry Guidelines
Reference - JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/01, JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/02, JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/03, VESI_URD_003; cl4.4.2, cl5.8.2 AS2053
Acceptance Criteria - HV & Comms: Conduit sizes as per IFC and VESI 4.4.2 CONDUITS USED WITHIN THE VESI NETWORKS SHALL BE HEAVY DUTY SOLID WALL, ELECTRICAL CONDUIT TO AS2053.
○ HV & COMMS CONDUITS TO HAVE A max BENDING RADIUS AS PER VESI_URD_003 - 5.8.2
○ Inspect materials upon delivery and attached delivery dockets.
Frequency - Each Material Type, Each Delivery
Verifying Documents - Attach Material Conformnace Certs, Attach delivery dockets
○ Pits to be used and installed as per IFC drawings and manafacturer requirements
○ Inspect materials upon delivery and attached delivery dockets.
Frequency - Each Material Type, Each Delivery
Verifying Documents - Attach Material Conformnace Certs, Attach delivery dockets
Reference - JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/01, JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/02, JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/03, AS/NZ 2648.1, VESI_URD_003 -5.5.2
○ Orange 150 or 300mm width marker tape compliant with AS/NZS 2648.1 shall be used
Frequency - Each Material Type, Each Delivery
Verifying Documents - Attach Material Conformnace Certs
Acceptance Criteria - Clearances are requried between individual electrical assets and between assets of other authorities.
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works
Acceptance Criteria - Survey to set out trench alignment and pits, and establish construction control (alignment and level). Survey to mark out existing services.
Acceptance Criteria - Check the revision of the IFC drawings are current as per the drawing register (on Teambinder)
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works and at regualr intervals
Acceptance Criteria - Trench profile and depth as per IFC drawings.
○ Depth of trench is to be sufficient to allow for the minimum cover as per IFC from the top of conduits.
○ Cl5.3.2 Within the VESI networks, cabbles shall be buried up to a maximum depth of 1400mm (max trench depth of 1500mm).
○ The bottom of the cable trench shall be level across its width and free from any protrusions and rubble that could cause damage to the conduits.
5.2 - Placement of Bedding/Embedment and Backfill of conduits
Reference - JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/01, JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/02, JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/03, VESI_URD_003 - 5.7, VESI_URD_003 -5.4.2.2
Acceptance Criteria - Conduits are configured in accordance with IFC drawings and meet cable separation requirements.
○ VESI 5.10.1.3 Where shown on the approved plan or by prior written approval conduits may be stacked in vertical alignment.
○ VESI 5.8.1 Conduits are to be provided with suitable non-perishable, watertight, endcaps or plugs. For any
Reference - JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/01, JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/02, JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/03, VESI_URD_003 -5.8, AS2032.
Acceptance Criteria - All conduit joints shall be made by utilising the spigot and socket ends.
○ Conduits are to be joined using solvent cement and comply with AS2032.
○ Socket ends to be placed firmly into the spigots prior to backfill.
Frequency - Each Joint in each trench
Acceptance Criteria - Inspection of conduits undertaken by VEDN accredited contractor
Acceptance Criteria - Marker tape shall be installed no closer than 150mm to the cover slab or conduit and no closer to the final surface level than 250mm.
○ Marker tape should be located no deeper than 600mm from FSL.
○ Tape to be one continuous length.
Reference - JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/01, JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/02, JEMEE-DW-UG-10061100/03, VESI_URD_003; cl5.9
Acceptance Criteria - Comms and electrical pits to be installed as per TC-2203
○ Pit chamber floor to be 100mm lower than the underside of the lowest conduit. Entry conduits installed 75mm into pit.
Backfill: Crushed rock is to be compacted in 150 layers arround the pit to bring the surface back to existing levels.
Acceptance Criteria - Survey report to include but not limited to:
– Conduits labelled as per trench profile
– Other significant points of the cable route
Acceptance Criteria - Jemena Audit form complete
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
Frequency - Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
